New-York Historical Society
New-York Historical Society Collection of Photographic Slides Collection
New-York Historical Society
PR 278
0.2 Linear feet 1 box
1960-1979 This collection is a format-based collection for small accessions of slides. It includes photographic slides of New York City in the 1960s and 1970s taken by amateur photographers Herbert Sendecki and Ray H. Billings.
Arrangement
The slides are arranged by photographer.
Preferred Citation
This collection should be cited as: New-York Historical Society Collection of Photographic Slides, PR 278, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, New-York Historical Society.
Provenance
Gift of Herbert Sendecki, 2008; gift of Raynette Billings Noles, 2009.
Use Restrictions
Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to 20 exposures of stable, unbound material per day.
Application to use images from this collection for publication should be made in writing to: Department of Rights and Reproductions, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194, rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org. Phone: (212) 873-3400 ext. 282.
Copyrights and other proprietary rights may subsist in individuals and entities other than the New-York Historical Society, in which case the patron is responsible for securing permission from those parties. For fuller information about rights and reproductions from N-YHS visit: https://www.nyhistory.org/about/rights-reproductions
Access Restrictions
Available by advance appointment only. To schedule an appointment, contact the Print Room Librarian at printroom@nyhistory.org.
Scope and Contents
This is a format-based collection for small accessions of slides. The collection consists of photographic slides taken by amateur photographers Herbert Sendecki and Ray H. Billings. The slides span the period from 1960 to 1979 and have been organized by photographer.
Sendecki Slides includes all of the photographic slides taken by Herbert Sendecki, which depict various New York City neighborhoods, street scenes, and buildings in 1963 and 1964.
Billings Slides includes interior shots of a New York City police department radio room from 1972, views of the 1964 World's Fair and other New York City sites, and views of Lake George and other unidentified locations outside New York City.
Separated Materials
A set of 686 slides by amateur photographer Ben Kabakow was removed from PR 278 and into its own collection, PR 413 Ben Kabakow Photographic Slides, in April 2020.
Accruals
This is a format-based collection for small accessions of slides; the collection is open for additional small accessions as they come in.
New York (N.Y.) -- Photographs.
Sendecki slides568881963-196411
Scope and Contents
Subjects include churches, bridges, Castle Clinton, Customs House, Fraunces Tavern, New York Stock Exchange, Federal Hall, Federal Reserve Bank, Pennsylvania Station, Cooper Union, Pan Am Building, City Hall, New York Post Office Building, Seaman's Institute, Rockefeller Center at Christmas, Chinatown, Greenwich Village, and others.Billings Slides570851960-197912
Scope and Contents
These slides were taken by amatuer photographer Ray H. Billings and include interior shots of a New York City police department radio room from 1972, views of the 1964 World's Fair and other New York City sites, and views of Lake George and other unidentified locations outside New York City.
